alert.note: Alert for Marion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 06 at 4:56PM CDT until April 06 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR EASTERN MARION COUNTY... At 454 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Whitwell to Bridgeport, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. Larger hail closer to the Alabama state line. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jasper, South Pittsburg, Whitwell, Kimball, Powells Crossroads, Martin Springs, Sequatchie Cave, Haletown (guild), New Hope and Hicks Gap State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for east Tennessee. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
